UART SVT UVM Documentation - Interfaces Reference

Interfaces for UART SVT UVM Documentation: Show All Interfaces

Interface Group Interfaces
Default Group svt_uart_if
svt_gpio_if

Interface Definition Documentation

 interface svt_uart_if
(
input bit clk
)
This SystemVerilog 'interface' definition declares all of the signals (scoped within an instance of this interface) that are specified by the UART Protocol.
The interface declares 'modports' that are to be used as logical port connections for the components.

Interface required Clock Signal as input argument. Clock Signal should be generated from the testbench. Input clock signal 'clk' is used as reference clock.

The Baud Rate Generator divides this clock by a divisor programmable from 1 to (2^16 - 1) to provide output baud clock.

The divisor can be configured through "baud_divisor", present in svt_uart_configuration class.

Modport for UART Monitor

 interface svt_gpio_if
(
input logic iClk,
input logic iSysRstz,
input logic [63:0] iGPi,
output logic [63:0] oGPo
)
Ports
bit
__dummy
 

 bit  attribute
 svt_uart_if::rst

This port is for reset: the UART SVT supports positive edge reset

 wire  attribute
 svt_uart_if::sin

This port is used as a Serial data port. This is output from DCE and input to DTE.

 wire  attribute
 svt_uart_if::dsr

This port is Data Set Ready (DSR) Port. This is output from DCE and input to DTE.

When active (pin is low), DSR indicates to DTE that DCE is ready to exchange data.

When "enable_dtr_dsr_handshake" (present in svt_uart_configuration class) is set to 1'b0, the value of dsr pin is don't care.

This pin is not relevant when handshake type is SOFTWARE and is used only in HARDWARE handshake type. The handshake type can be configured through "handshake_type", present in svt_uart_configuration_class.

 wire  attribute
 svt_uart_if::cts

This port is Clear to send (CTS) port. This is output from DCE and input to DTE when "enable_tx_rx_handshake" (present in svt_uart_configuration class) is set to 1'b0 and input to both DTE and DCE when "enable_tx_rx_handshake" is set to 1'b1.

This pin is not relevant when handshake type is SOFTWARE and is used only in HARDWARE handshake type.

The handshake type can be configured through "handshake_type", present in svt_uart_configuration_class.

When "enable_rts_cts_handshake" (present in svt_uart_configuration class) is set to 1'b0, the value of cts pin is don't care.

 wire  attribute
 svt_uart_if::dtr

This port is Data Terminal Ready (DTR) Port. This is output from DTE and input to DCE.

When active (pin is low) DTR indicates to DCE that DTE is ready to exchange data.

When "enable_dtr_dsr_handshake" (present in svt_uart_configuration class) is set to 1'b0, the value of dtr pin is don't care.

This pin is not relevant when handshake type is SOFTWARE and is used only in HARDWARE handshake type.

The handshake type can be configured through "handshake_type", present in svt_uart_configuration_class.

 wire  attribute
 svt_uart_if::rts

This port is Request To Send (RTS) port. This is output from DTE and input to DCE when "enable_tx_rx_handshake" (present in svt_uart_configuration class) is set to 1'b0 and output of both DTE and DCE when "enable_tx_rx_handshake" is set to 1'b1.

This pin is not relevant when handshake type is SOFTWARE and is used only in HARDWARE handshake type.

The handshake type can be configured through "handshake_type", present in svt_uart_configuration_class.

When "enable_rts_cts_handshake" (present in svt_uart_configuration class) is set to 1'b0, the value of rts pin is don't care.

 wire  attribute
 svt_uart_if::sout

This port is used as a Serial data port. This is output from DTE and input to DCE.

 wire  attribute
 svt_uart_if::baudout

baudout pin drives the output of baud rate generator of vip, i.e. the baud rate clock for general purpose system use.

VIP drives baudout pin only when "enable_drive_baudout_pin" (present in svt_uart_configuration class) is set to 1'b1

 bit  attribute
 svt_gpio_if::__dummy
